meanings.definition: To mark with a line or lines above or over.
meanings.sent1: She decided to overscore the important points in her notes.
meanings.sent2: The teacher used a red pen to overscore the errors in the essay.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to overscore its territory by scratching the furniture.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his work overscored his commitment to excellence.
meanings.sent5: The bright red overscore on the document caught everyone's attention.

meanings.sent1: During the presentation, she would overscore the key ideas on the slides.
meanings.sent2: The speaker used gestures to overscore the importance of his message.
meanings.sent3: His love for ice cream would overscore any other dessert choice.
meanings.sent4: The sunset overscored the beauty of the beach.
meanings.sent5: Her smile overscored her happiness at the surprise party.

meanings.definition: A line or lines drawn above or over something to indicate emphasis or importance.
meanings.sent1: The overscore on the document made the heading stand out.
meanings.sent2: In typography, an overscore is used to highlight specific text.
meanings.sent3: The overscore on the cake made it look like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like an overscore in the quiet room.
meanings.sent5: The overscore on the map indicated the location of the hidden treasure.
